intro: Oldenlandia maingayi, commonly known as the African mosquito plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that resemble mosquitoes, hence its common name. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and opposite leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in disturbed soils or along riverbanks. Its ornamental value has made it popular in horticulture, although it can be invasive in some areas.
